A.text: You and your foe both stumble.

B.text: You lunge 5 feet past your foe.

C.text: Try again. What will your friends say?

E.text: You made a good sound effect.

A.text: Foe recognizes this assault from grade school.

B.text: Your opponent stands firmly in front of you.

C.text: When your attempt starts to fail, you slip in a punch.

D.text: Your grip is neither firm or effective. Foe breaks free.

E.text: It is solid, even if randomly placed.

A.text: Powerful strike fails to land solid. It still does some damage.

B.text: Weak side strike glances off kidneys. It could have been great.

C.text: Knuckle foe's arm. You will need to do better than this.

D.text: Back strike. It has little imagination. You might as well punch.

A.text: Foe seeks to push you away. He lashes out in defensive manner.

B.text: Glancing side blow. You unbalance your foe. He recovers quickly.

C.text: Strike side. Foe moves back to block your next attack.

D.text: Blow to foe's side sends him reeling. Foe checks wound for the damage.

E.text: Blow to foe's side unbalances him and destroys equipment there.

A.text: On line strike, but weak. Foe steps back and feigns an attack to draw off your assault.

B.text: Your strike makes foe's footing uncertain. He pushes you clear and begins to right himself.

C.text: Shot to foe's chest. His lungs hesitate. He coughs it off and regains his footing.

D.text: Quick shot to chest causes foe to hesitate in pain. He still knows you're there.

E.text: Crack! Foe's rib reports damage to him in an unsubtle way. He is in pain.

A.text: Light bash breaks foe's focus. You have the initiative next round.

B.text: You salvage your attack by tripping foe. You have the initiative next round.

C.text: Grab foe's shoulder, while you bring your knee up to knock him over.

D.text: Strike to calf. Wound impairs foe's movements. You have the initiative.

E.text: Hard glancing blow to foe's leg.

A.text: Attempt to spin foe's around almost succeeds. Weak grip to side.

B.text: Your assault threatens to succeed. Your foe goes defensive to avoid your attack.

C.text: Boom! Foe is hit in the face. He reels back 5 feet trying to regain his footing. His guard is down.

D.text: Double strike to both arms breaks foe's defense. He is open to attack and is having trouble recovering.

E.text: Shot in back staggers foe for an instant. His guard drops and he is sadly unprotected.

A.text: Firm press to foe's chest. He give ground happily. Watch his weapon.

B.text: Grab foe and bring knee up to cause damage. Foe blocks some of the force.

C.text: Push foe's knee backwards. Foe struggles to avoid the pain.

D.text: Strike to chest takes wind out of foe. Foe's guard goes down.

E.text: Knock foe over as if he was a sack of beans. He hits and starts to stand up.

A.text: Strike thigh. Foe is pushed back.

B.text: Foe bumps his thigh while blocking your attack. He steps back.

C.text: Skipping calf strike. Foe does not give ground.

D.text: Miss foe's side and strike his thigh. You have initiative for 3 rounds.

E.text: Strike causes foe to fumble his stride. He almost falls down. Foe is recovering.

A.text: Foe's arm is pinned for a moment. He recovers by twisting you off.

B.text: Bend weapon arm in the wrong direction. Foe drops his weapon.

C.text: Excellent placement. Strike to weapon arm disarms foe. Foe is in great peril.

D.text: You catch foe's counter thrust and disarm him with a bash to the arm.

E.text: Bash foe in shoulder making him spin. You push him for good measure.

A.text: Shoulder strike sends foe spinning. He comes all the way around before stopping. Well placed shot.

B.text: Stirke to foe's elbow numbs it. He drops his weapon and grips his elbow. He forgets you are still attacking him.

C.text: Strike to foe's leg sends him down. Foe's knee is broken and his doom is at hand. He falls to the ground helpless.

D.text: Hard strike to head. If foe has no helm, he is knocked out for 24 hours. If he has a helm, he is knocked back 10 feet.

E.text: Knock foe back with a blow to the jaw. Foe loses balance and falls. he hits his head and goes unconscious.

A.text: Hasty press upon foe's chest produces excellent results. Foe is unbalanced.

B.text: Grab loose piece of foe's garments and use it to throw him around. Foe is confused.

C.text: Strike to foe's ribs. Foe's ribs crack and foe shows the pain. His war effort is impaired.

D.text: Break foe's collar bone. Spin foe around. He is disoriented and out of position.

E.text: Shoulder strike blasts foe down. He lands on his stomach and tries to roll over. Minor fracture.

A.text: Hammer foe's lower leg. He has trouble standing, but manages.

B.text: Solid damage to foe's calf. His attempts to avoid the pain make him an easier target.

C.text: Bruise foe's leg. Muscles suffer damage and foe limps back from your reach.

D.text: Lift foe up into the air. You send him sprawling on the ground. He drops his weapon.

E.text: Knock foe down with a blow to the thigh. He lands on his wespon and takes some time to get off it.

A.text: Blow to foe's shield side. If foe has a shield, it is torn away.

B.text: Grab foe's shield arm for leverage. You treat it badly, trying to unbalance foe.

C.text: Heavy blow to foe's weapon arm. Mild fracture. Foe is knocked back 5 feet.

D.text: Sweep foe to the side and knock him over. He breaks his ankle.

E.text: Strike to foe's shield arm. Foe stumbles 3 feet and falls down. Foe is disarmed.

A.text: Side strike. Disoriented foe strikes out for you in the wrong direction. You move to take advantage.

B.text: Good shot to foe's side sends him stumble to the right 3 feet. It must have really hurt.

C.text: Strike to foe's side. He almost goes down, but recovers by dropping everything in his shield arm.

D.text: Brutal strike sends foe down. You step on his weapon arm and hold it down. Foe should surrender.

E.text: Awesome side shot sends foe tripping sideways. He goes down rolling and breaks a leg.

A.text: Elbow to the back. Foe stumbles 5 feet sideways. Foe cannot seem to get his head clear

B.text: You really hammer foe. He reels back 10 feet. He almost went down. You move in to finish him.

C.text: Precise blow sends foe down. Foe is face down and disarmed.

D.text: Strike foe's shield arm. If foe has a shield it is broken. If not the arm is broken.

E.text: Cruel blow to foe's head.... Foe sees stars. Foe is knocked back 10 feet, but remains standing.

A.text: Head strike. If foe has no helm, he is knocked out for 2 hours. If foe has a helm, he is better off.

B.text: Blow to side of foe's head. Strike damages his ear and balance. Foe is impaired for 3 weeks.

C.text: Spin foe around. He ends up 10 feet from you and facing the wrong direction. Foe fumbles his weapon.

D.text: Foe stumbles back from you 10 feet and takes a full round to fall. He hits hard and fractures an arm. He is down.

E.text: Blow to foe's shield shoulder. If foe has no shield, he is knocked down,has a useless arm, and passes out.

A.text: Strike to foe's stomach. He bends down in pain and you send him sprawling on his face. He hits harder than you could have hoped.

B.text: Bash foe in his side. His legs forget to follow as he steps back. He falls in an embarrassing prone position. He has no clue to what happened.

C.text: Smooth and snazzy strike sends foe down on his knees. His weapon goes flying. Foe has blacked out. He stares straight ahead without blinking.

D.text: Strike head and shatter foe's helm. Pieces fly in all diections. If foe has no helm he is in a coma foe 4 weeks.

E.text: Solid strike snaps foe's neck. He falls back 5 feet, spins, and tumbles to the ground. He dies of shock and suffocation in 3 rounds.

A.text: Brutal hip strike knocks foe down. Fall tears tendons, and fractures bone in leg. The pain his great. Foe is incoherent for 9 hours.

B.text: Send foe flying 10 feet. He lands on his face. The twisting of his neck causes nerve damage. He is paralyzed from the waist down.

C.text: Powerful strike flips foe into the air before smashing him to the ground. Foe breaks both arms and hits his head. Foe is in a coma for 2 months.

D.text: Savage blow to foe's head. Foe is knocked down. He falls into a coma and dies in 12 rounds due to a severed vein.

E.text: Frightening strike to foe's head. Temple crushed, neck broken. Foe lands 20 feet away. He dies instantly.
